title: Chrissy Teigen's Response to John Legend Being Hacked Is Seriously the Best
text:
John Legend isn't quiet about his distaste for Donald Trump, but things took a decidedly darker turn on his Twitter feed on Friday evening.
A string of profanity-laden tweets littered John's feed. “I can’t stand by and be silent, @realDonaldTrump, you’re a b---h ass n---a and if I see you, I’m stomping your s--t you f--kin’ cheetoh,” one read, and then, “i will follow 5 who follow @Owen755.”
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Yep, you guessed it — he was hacked! And yep, you guessed again, it was by user @Owen755 who claimed responsibility for the hack with a “That was fun” tweet. (The account has since been suspended.)
John then took to Twitter to apologize for the hacking, and clear things up with his fans.
I'm back. My hacker was vulgar and kinda hilarious. I'll try to be funnier from now on so he won't feel the need to ghost write for me.
— John Legend (@johnlegend) February 25, 2017 I would never threaten violence to the President. No matter how much I wish he would go away.
— John Legend (@johnlegend) February 25, 2017 Advertisement - Continue Reading Below I wouldn't call him a Cheeto because I enjoy Cheetos.
— John Legend (@johnlegend) February 25, 2017 I did call him Liar-In-Chief. Then my hacker took over to do the Angrier John version of it all.
— John Legend (@johnlegend) February 25, 2017 Advertisement - Continue Reading Below My hacker's assessment of my endowment was confusing. Big in the tweet about Hillary. Small in the bio. Make up your mind, hacker.
— John Legend (@johnlegend) February 25, 2017 And you know John's wife Chrissy had to get in on the action; the model tweeted out a screenshot of a DM she received while the hacker was in John's account.
Best dm of my life @yashar pic.twitter.com/Kqn21nEXfX
— christine teigen (@chrissyteigen) February 25, 2017 How are these two still the perfect couple in the face of a hacking? I would hate them if I didn't love them so damn much. (If they ever break up, I will burn the internet to the ground. That is both a warning and a promise.)
